replies.msg: #mufc are keen to continue with the summer policy of signing young players (preferably British). The key is youth and character, but the club are also looking to recruit players who are 'humble but arrogant' — respect for team-mates but self-belief under pressure #mulive [times]

#mufc looked at hundreds of right-backs around the world before signing Wan-Bissaka. It was an extensive process with input from 32 scouts in more than 30 countries. Data on each player was analysed by 15 people #mulive [times]

Solskjær's job at #mufc is safe even if the club suffer a bad defeat to Liverpool. The board are determined to be patient with him, acknowledging the scale of the role he has taken on #mulive [times]

Solskjær had a right of veto on the process of transfers this summer, which he will retain when #mufc appoint a technical director, as planned #mulive [times]

Solskjær has held a series of meetings regarding four signings, including a centre forward, they want to make next year #mulive [times]

Regarding not replacing Lukaku and Sánchez this summer, #mufc did not want to sign players that did not fit Solskjær's 'cultural reboot' #mulive [times]

replies.msg:
Mourinho has been out of a job since he was sacked by Manchester United in December and the Portuguese is reportedly waiting in the wings.

Tottenham have made contact with Jose Mourinho amid uncertainty over manager Mauricio Pochettino, reports French outlert SoccerLink.

Pochettino's future in London is up in the air following Tottenham's poor start to the season, highlighted by a humiliating 7-2 Champions League loss to Bayern Munich.

While Pochettino is not facing the sack, Spurs have sounded out Mourinho about whether the former Chelsea and Manchester United boss would be interested.
